title: Glory Unwanted

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: We are the Daein Liberation Army! Everyone, hold tight! You'll be safe soon!

intro.speaker: Youth
intro.line: Look at her hair... Could it be the Silver-Haired Maiden? Our country's savior, come to rescue us?

intro.speaker: Radmin
intro.line: Whether they suspected a trap or not, they're here. Brazen fools! All hands, take battle positions!

intro.speaker: Radmin
intro.line: Silver-haired wench! I'm going to drown you and all of Daein's hopes in these filthy waters! You've no escape!

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Don't get too smug, you cruel cowards! We have a little something up our sleeves too. Tormod! Here's your chance!

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Rafiel, even you came to help?

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: What happened just now? What was that strange song?

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: That was Vigor, a heron galdr that can reenergize our allies in a fight. Don't be distracted, Micaiah! Let's set our formation while we can.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: We're just about ready. Let's talk to Tormod, and--

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Micaiah?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Oh, sorry.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Hey, remember our promise from three years ago? There are no secrets between us.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Sothe, Muarim knows that I'm older than I look.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: I see. Well, don't worry too much about it. You can trust him.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Yes, I'm sure of that. Muarim seems very trustworthy. But, what about everyone else? What would they think if they knew all of my abilities came from the mixed blood running through my veins? Blood they consider cursed!

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Micaiah, stop...

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Right now, when they look at me, they have love and affection in their eyes, but would they look at me the same way if they knew? I don't want to find out, Sothe. I don't think I could bear the truth.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: You know, we can stop.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: What do you mean?

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Look, this was an impossible situation to begin with. You've always led such a secluded life... Ever since you were thrust into this position, I worried that the pressure might get to you.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: You're right. I knew it would turn out like this. Despite that, I accepted the job. I can't stop now.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: But, Micaiah...

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Listen, Sothe. I realized something after Daein lost the war.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: What's that?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I realized how much I loved my country.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: And?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: During the war, I spent a lot of time with the people of Daein while I was waiting for you to return. After we lost the war, all our cities and towns had been reduced to ruins. We had to help each other to cope. We supported and comforted each other. That's how we survived.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: You never mentioned this before.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I've been secluded so long, I had no idea people were so strong...and kind. No one knew who I was, but they helped me because I was from Daein. They were so...loving. They were my friends.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: And now you won't leave them.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I was touched by their kindness. Now, I'm scared to lose it. Very scared.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Micaiah...

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I suppose this isn't the time to worry about such things. If my power is needed to liberate Daein, I will stand my ground and fight.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Well, not to spoil your resolve... But if things get too hot, I'm just going to grab you and run.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Sothe...

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Friends and Daein are important, but not as important as you are to me. Remember that.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: ...All right. Thank you, Sothe.

conversation.speaker: Tauroneo
conversation.line: Sorry about this, Lady Micaiah. Just this once, I agree with Lord Izuka’s concerns.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I completely understand. This is my fight, and mine alone. Please keep the prince safe, General Tauroneo.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: I’ll protect Micaiah. I’ve enlisted extra help, too. We’ll make it back in one piece.

conversation.speaker: Tauroneo
conversation.line: I place my trust in you, Sothe. Best of luck. Oh, I nearly forgot. You should take this.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: What a peculiar staff… What power does it possess?

conversation.speaker: Tauroneo
conversation.line: It is a restore staff. It will help you recover from poison, sleep, and paralysis. Enemies will use every method they possess to destroy you. It is best that you be prepared for every eventuality.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Thank you, General Tauroneo. We will return safely.

conversation.speaker: Tauroneo
conversation.line: I know. And I know you’ll save the hostages, too.

conversation.speaker: Vika
conversation.line: Hm… I wonder where Boss is? These tents all look the same…

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Hello, Vika. Can I help you?

conversation.speaker: Vika
conversation.line: Meep!

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Vika!

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: You always run away from me… Did I do something to offend you?

conversation.speaker: Vika
conversation.line: No, I’m so sorry. I can’t explain why this happens. I get so jumpy around you. There’s just… something about you.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Oh…

conversation.speaker: Vika
conversation.line: Oh, but please don’t be sad! It’s not you. It’s me. I get…confused…sometimes. I really admire you, and then I get a bizarre feeling, and…

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: It’s all right. Sorry to bother you.

conversation.speaker: Vika
conversation.line: …No. Wait.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Hm?

conversation.speaker: Vika
conversation.line: I want to overcome this. I don’t like that I feel I must avoid you for some inexplicable reason.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: But…

conversation.speaker: Vika
conversation.line: I know how painful it is to be…feared. I’m really, really sorry. Let’s be friends, OK? If you can forgive me, that is…

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Of course I forgive you! Thank you, Vika. I’d be honored to have your friendship.

conversation.speaker: Vika
conversation.line: Here. Take this as a token of that friendship. Please, take it. I’d like you to have it.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: What a beautiful figurine. The goddess looks so serene.

conversation.speaker: Vika
conversation.line: Carry it with you. It’ll bring you good luck. I met my boss and Muarim thanks to that figurine.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Thank you, Vika. I’ll cherish it.

conversation.speaker: Vika
conversation.line: I’m glad you like it.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: Queen Nailah, are you sure it's all right involving not only you, but Rafiel, as well?

battle-talk.speaker: Nailah
battle-talk.line: Rafiel can't fly, so sometimes he has trouble keeping up. But even so, the effects of his galdr make him a valuable asset in battle. All I ask is that you keep him near me, so I can keep him safe.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: Rafiel...why did you come? I thought herons abhorred fighting...

battle-talk.speaker: Rafiel
battle-talk.line: Wherever the queen goes, I follow. I practice seid magic... Even if I cannot fight, I can lend strength to my friends and companions.

battle-talk.speaker: Micaiah
battle-talk.line: Yes, I heard you singing to Queen Nailah and Volug earlier. We are blessed to have you at our side.

battle-talk.speaker: Rafiel
battle-talk.line: And if I sing to you, I can restore your spirits as well, so that you might attack your foes swiftly.

battle-talk.speaker: Rafiel
battle-talk.line: Helping you would give me great joy.

boss.speaker: Radmin
boss.line: Silver-Haired Maiden, or whoever you really are! I knew you'd come! I knew how your reputation would suffer if you abandoned these prisoners here. You had no choice but to come.

boss.speaker: Micaiah
boss.line: How many innocent, defenseless people have you ordered killed...just to lure me here?

boss.speaker: Radmin
boss.line: Look who's passing judgment! Maiden of Miracles, Savior of Daein... You've spun quite a pack of lies to inspire your conquered people. But that ends here, wench! Let's show them how insignificant you really are!

boss.speaker: Radmin
boss.line: That wench...her powers...much...too dangerous... She mustn't be allowed...to...

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: We're nearly back to camp. I wonder if the prince will overlook the fact that I insisted on this mission?

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: I'm sure he'll be happy when he sees the prisoners are safe.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Sothe...do you hear a noise coming from the canyon? Is it...people shouting?

end.speaker: Daein
end.line: Look! Look up there! The Maiden has returned! And the prisoners are with her!

end.speaker: Daein
end.line: She won another victory! She escaped their trap and destroyed the enemy...again!

end.speaker: Daein
end.line: Radiant with divine protection, she truly has the goddess's blessing! The Silver-Haired Maiden! Our priestess!

end.speaker: Daein
end.line: Priestess...of Dawn! Hooray, Lady Micaiah!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: What could they be celebrating?

end.speaker: Nailah
end.line: It seems the soldiers are celebrating your liberation of the prisoners. You should wave to them. People like their heroes to seem approachable. It would make them happy.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: I'm no hero... But I see what you mean.

end.speaker: Daein
end.line: What a glorious sight she is!

end.speaker: Daein
end.line: Lady Micaiah! Lady Micaiah, the Priestess of Dawn!

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Here you are. I've been looking for you.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Sothe, after all those soldiers cheering... I feel like I'm doing real good here...

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: ...Micaiah?

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: Sothe! Please, come quick! There's something wrong with Muarim!

end.speaker: Muarim
end.line: Ghh...grraaahrrrr...

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: Muarim, get ahold of yourself! Look at me!

end.speaker: Muarim
end.line: ...Gh... Li...ttle...one...

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: This happens over and over... Muarim suddenly transforms, and...he growls like he's losing his mind. And if I...if I grab him and yell his name again and again, he returns to himself, but...then it just starts over. And...and...when he's growling, his eyes, they look... It's as if, as if one of "them" is looking at me...

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: "Them"? One of "them"? One of who?

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: You can't mean... No!

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: H-help him, please. I don't know what to do. The time between transformations is getting shorter and shorter...

end.speaker: Muarim
end.line: Agh... My body can't... ...No, no, no... Little one...get away...

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: No, I won't let you! I'll die before I let you go feral! Muarim! Look at me!

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: That song...

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Rafiel...

end.speaker: Muarim
end.line: Gh...

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: Wha--! Muarim! Muarim!

end.speaker: Rafiel
end.line: ...The galdr of rebirth restores twisted bodies and souls to their proper states. He will be all right now.

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: Th...thank you... Without Muarim...life would be...terrible...

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: What was that song? It was different than when he sang before...

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: It was the galdr of rebirth. I heard it once before, in the war. But... Micaiah, what's wrong?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: I feel...odd. Maybe it was the song... I'm shaking, for some reason... But I'm truly glad that Muarim will be all right...

end.speaker: Pelleas
end.line: Feral Ones?

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: In the Mad King's War... Daein's military developed living weapons. They were called "Feral Ones"...laguz that had been warped and twisted by terrible experiments.

end.speaker: Izuka
end.line: "Terrible," you say?! Do you mean to refute the highly effective results of my brilliant research?!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Then it was you! You secretly gave Muarim the drug to turn him into a Feral One!

end.speaker: Izuka
end.line: And what's wrong with that? Maintaining constant battle strength in beast state... How splendid!

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: How dare you! Transforming laguz into Feral Ones dramatically shortens their life spans. It destroys their sense of self, and they do nothing but fight until they die! And you! You gave Muarim that drug!

end.speaker: Izuka
end.line: Pawns need no sense of self! It's only natural to sacrifice soldiers for victory in war!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: You twisted maniac! You are the lowest--

end.speaker: Pelleas
end.line: Everybody! Wait, please! Izuka clearly did a terrible thing to that sub-hum--that laguz, I apologize. Tormod... I'm truly sorry. He will not use the drug again. So, please... Try to forgive him...

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Prince Pelleas...

end.speaker: Izuka
end.line: My prince! We must not have royalty bowing and scraping before swine like--

end.speaker: Tormod
end.line: ...That's enough!

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Tormod!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Let him go...

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: I see... Is that true?

end.speaker: Lekain
end.line: Yes, Apostle. Our occupation forces have engaged in appalling and inhumane excesses in Daein. These excesses were perpetrated entirely outside the knowledge of the occupational governor, Duke Numida.

end.speaker: Numida
end.line: I come to you penitent... Failing my duties as governor, I, Numida, share a measure of guilt for this disaster. I am prepared to take the appropriate punishment, Apostle Sanaki. However, I feel that freeing the people of Daein from the clutches of our oppression is our most urgent task...

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: Urgent, you say? Then we must make haste. We will forthwith convene an inspection team and request a meeting with the army led by the late King Ashnard's orphan. We will assure them of Begnion's intentions. Then, we will immediately address the occupation force's tyranny.

end.speaker: Lekain
end.line: Excellent! In that case, please deign to allow me, your humble servant Lekain, to lead the inspection team. The soldiers who have stained the empire's name will be toppled where they stand! I promise, they shall not live to return here.

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: That is unacceptable. I will decide the soldiers' punishment only after hearing their side. And I have chosen to appoint Sephiran, Duke Persis, to lead the investigation team. Is that acceptable, Sephiran?

end.speaker: Sephiran
end.line: I hear and I obey, my empress.

end.speaker: Lekain
end.line: What?! But, but, Apostle Sanaki...

end.speaker: Sanaki
end.line: This is a dire situation. Accordingly, I judge the prime minister, Duke Persis, to be more suited to the role than you, Vice-Minister Lekain. That is all.

end.speaker: Lekain
end.line: Hrrgh...

end.speaker: Numida
end.line: L-Lord Lekain...! What shall I do?!

end.speaker: Lekain
end.line: Duke Numida, my friend... I'm afraid you must sacrifice every last Begnion in the Imperial Occupation Army.

end.speaker: Numida
end.line: What? Th-that's ridiculous! But...grrgh! Blast that spoiled brat and her cunning little schemes... You'll regret this, Apostle Sanaki!

narration: Micaiah and her small band of fighters knowingly walk into a trap to save condemned Daein prisoners. Even without the benefit of Izuka's vast information network, news of Micaiah's heroism in Shifu Swamp spreads like wildfire across Daein.

The once-hopeless citizens of Daein dub her the Priestess of Dawn and find their spirits restored. In their troubled hearts, they see in her nothing less than the promise of salvation. Throughout Daein, the people rise as one against the brutality of their oppressors. Begnion's occupying forces cannot deal with open war on so many fronts.

General Jarod redeploys his men to key locations to better defend the capital city. Jarod's forces still outnumber those of the Daein liberators, and he has hardened his defenses in hopes of holding off Micaiah's army.

The liberation forces fight with a fury not to be denied, however, and the occupation army begins to lose its will to fight. Breaking through enemy lines again and again, Micaiah's forces gain vital ground and momentum.
Despite the anger Micaiah feels toward Izuka for his treatment of their laguz allies, she continues to lead the army in its lightning-quick advance. Nevassa is now mere days away.
